alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 12:47PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Water Levels and Local Runoff Possible Next Week... A strong low has moved onshore and brought more precipitation, including heavier precipitation, in the Western Brooks Range and parts of the Interior. Warming temperatures across the region later this week, combined with a much above normal snowpack over higher elevations, is/will cause a significant increase in snowmelt. Runoff into rivers south of the Brooks Range is causing water levels to rise and breakup to begin on some rivers. Local ice jams may form and result in elevated water levels. The increased runoff may also cause smaller rivers and streams to rise to bankfull levels or overbank in low lying areas. People along rivers and streams should prepare for the possibility of high water levels this week due to ice breakup and snowmelt runoff. River access points and gravel bars will likely be covered with water along with increased debris in rivers. The latest breakup information is available at www.weather.gov/aprfc/breakupMap.
